Title: In Praise of Community: Shared Creativity in Arts and Politics in Italy (1959-1979)

This project, "In Praise of Community," explores the intersection of performing arts and politics in Italy during the 1960s and 1970s. Focusing on the concept of "commonality practices," we will study, collect, and contextualize artist collaborations that emerged during this period of significant social and cultural change. By applying the "will-to-the-common" concept to counterculture art, we will highlight the significance of artistic communities both locally and internationally. Our innovative approach will employ new modeling of performing arts knowledge and interpretation, as well as cutting-edge digital archive visualization. The project's outcomes will include a comprehensive approach to collecting, digitalizing, restoring, and disseminating Italian performing arts heritage, ultimately preserving this valuable cultural legacy. By examining the historical, philosophical, artistic, and sociological debates of the time, we will create a rich digital archive of Italian artists' performances, shedding new light on the role of community in shaping artistic expression.

This project, INCOMMON, explores the intersection of performing arts, politics, and community in Italy during the 1960s and 1970s. Focusing on the concept of "commonality practices," we will study, collect, and contextualize artist collaborations that emerged during this period of social and cultural transformation. By applying the "will-to-the-common" concept to counterculture art, we will highlight the significance of artistic communities both locally and internationally. The project's outcomes will include a comprehensive approach to collecting, digitalizing, restoring, and disseminating Italian performing arts heritage, as well as the preservation of this cultural legacy. INCOMMON will be the first study to systematically analyze the field of performing arts as resulting from the practice of commonality, providing a novel perspective on the role of community in shaping artistic expression and cultural identity.
